intro: Cirsium wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan thistle, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and showy purple to pink composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
